apiDocumentation.title: Coffee Shop Revenue Management Backend - Frontend API Reference
apiDocumentation.description: Comprehensive API documentation for Frontend developers to integrate with the Coffee Shop Revenue Management Backend

authentication.note: Currently no authentication is implemented. All endpoints are publicly accessible.

BaseEntity.description: All entities extend this base with common fields

message: name must be longer than or equal to 1 characters
name must be longer than or equal to 1 characters

products.description: Manage products with soft delete and category relationships

CreateProductDto.typescript:
interface CreateProductDto {
  name: string;              // Required, min length 1
  description?: string;      // Optional
  price: number;             // Required, min 0
  image?: string;            // Optional
  categoryId: number;        // Required
  status?: ProductStatus;    // Optional, defaults to 'active'
}

UpdateProductDto.typescript:
interface UpdateProductDto {
  name?: string;             // Optional, min length 1
  description?: string;      // Optional
  price?: number;            // Optional, min 0
  image?: string;            // Optional
  categoryId?: number;       // Optional
  status?: ProductStatus;    // Optional
}

example.name: Cappuccino
example.description: A classic Italian coffee drink with espresso and steamed milk foam

example.name: Cappuccino
example.description: A classic Italian coffee drink with espresso and steamed milk foam

400.description: Bad request - Invalid data or category not found

validation.name: Required, string, minimum length 1
validation.categoryId: Required, number, must reference existing category

endpoints.summary: Get all products with optional category filter (excludes soft-deleted products)

400.description: Bad request - Invalid data or category not found

endpoints.summary: Soft delete a product (sets deletedAt timestamp)
endpoints.note: Soft-deleted products are excluded from GET /products queries

orders.description: Manage orders with lifecycle and order details

endpoints.summary: Create a new order with order details

400.description: Bad request - Invalid data or products not found

validation.orderDetails: Required, array with at least 1 item

businessLogic.defaultCustomerName: Defaults to 'Khách vãng lai' if not provided

endpoints.summary: Get all orders with optional customer name filter

customerName.description: Filter orders by customer name (partial match)

endpoints.summary: Get an order by ID with all details and products

200.description: Order found with order details and products

400.description: Bad request - Cancellation reason required when status is cancelled

example.message: Cancellation reason is required when status is cancelled

endpoints.summary: Delete an order (hard delete with cascade)
endpoints.note: Deleting an order will cascade delete all associated order details

revenue.description: Generate revenue reports with payment method breakdown

endpoints.summary: Get daily revenue report for a specific date

date.description: Report date in YYYY-MM-DD format (defaults to today)

businessLogic.dateDefault: If date parameter is not provided, defaults to today
businessLogic.revenueCalculation: Sum of all order detail subtotals for paid orders on the specified date

endpoints.summary: Get revenue reports for a date range

200.description: Revenue reports for the date range

businessLogic.dateRange: Returns one report per day in the range (inclusive)
businessLogic.emptyDays: Days with no paid orders will have totalOrders: 0 and totalRevenue: 0

typescript.description: TypeScript interfaces and enums for Frontend implementation
typescript.setupInstructions: Copy these type definitions to your Frontend project

apiService.description: Example API service implementation using Axios

reactExample.description: Example React component using the API service

dateFormatting.example:
const date = new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0]; // '2024-01-15'
await apiService.getDailyRevenue(date);

tips: Calculate subtotal on frontend: subtotal = quantity * unitPrice
Validate that products exist before creating order
Ensure at least one order detail is provided
Use current product price as unitPrice to preserve historical pricing

steps: 1. Copy TypeScript enums from implementationGuide.typescript.enums to your project
2. Copy TypeScript interfaces from implementationGuide.typescript.interfaces to your project
4. Copy API service from implementationGuide.apiService to your project
6. Import and use apiService in your components
7. Access Swagger UI at http://localhost:3000/api for interactive testing
